ie.dit.comp.bank

Class CreditCardAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.dit.comp.bank.BankAccount
      • ie.dit.comp.bank.CreditCardAccount

  • public class CreditCardAccount
extends BankAccount
    Credit Card Account where a credit limit can be specified, and accounts can be overdrawn up to this amount. Extends BankAccount and implements Tellable (since this is implemented at a higher level)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ie.dit.comp.bank.BankAccount

        balance, name

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CreditCardAccount()
      Default constructor, sets the balance to 0, and the name to an empty string
      CreditCardAccount(int balance, java.lang.String name)
      Constructor to read in balance and name
      CreditCardAccount(int balance, java.lang.String name, int creditLimit)
      Constructor to read in balance, name and credit limit

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deposit(int amt)
      Takes an int parameter specifying how much is to be deposited, this will be added to the balance.
      int getCreditLimit()
      Returns the credit limit in the account
      void withdraw(int amt)
      Takes an int parameter specifying how much is to be withdrawn, this will be subtracted from the balance, only if there are sufficient funds (including the credit limit).

      • Methods inherited from class ie.dit.comp.bank.BankAccount

        getBalance

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

                         java.lang.String name,

        Parameters:
        balance - The initial balance of the account
        name - The name of the account
        creditLimit - The amount by which the account can be over drawn

    • Method Detail

      • getCreditLimit

        public int getCreditLimit()
        Returns the credit limit in the account
        Returns:
        Amount by which the account can be over drawn

      • deposit

        public void deposit(int amt)
        Takes an int parameter specifying how much is to be deposited, this will be added to the balance. Over-rides the abstract method from above.
        Specified by:
        deposit in class BankAccount
        Parameters:
        amt - Amount to be deposited

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(int amt)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Takes an int parameter specifying how much is to be withdrawn, this will be subtracted from the balance, only if there are sufficient funds (including the credit limit). Over-rides the abstract method from above.
        Specified by:
        withdraw in class BankAccount
        Parameters:
        amt - Amount to be withdrawn
        Throws:
        CreditCardAccountOverdrawnException - Thrown if there are insufficient funds available for this withdrawl (including credit limit)
        java.lang.Exception
